result.execSummary:
John A Bell was found not guilty on all charges in this case. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John A Bell is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

Court's Exhibits 1 & 2

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 9:10 for Day 2 of Jury trial.  Parties discuss Jury Instructions.  Defense maintains objection to the substantive jury instruction.  Jurors recalled at 9:26.  Court reads jury instructions.  Closing arguments by the State.  Closing arguments by the Defense.  Rebuttal by the State.  Court reads final jury instructions.  Civilian bailiff sworn in.  2 alternate jurors selected and excused.  Jurors excused to deliberate at 10:12.  Parties agree that the exhibits may go in to the jury room if requested.  Court takes recess at 10:14.  Jurors sent a note at 10:26 that was marked as Court's Exhibit #1.  Exhibit 1 sent into the jury room as a response.  Jurors send a note at 12:40 that was marked as Court's Exhibit #2.  Exhibit 2 sent into the jury room as a response.  Jurors reached a verdict at 1:20.  Trial resumed at 1:33.  Jurors find the defendant not guilty.  Jurors discharged at 1:37.  Defense moves for Judgment of acquittal.  Court grants Judgment on the verdict.
Juror's Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Voir Dire List
Random Listing Report - Voir Dire

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 8:35 for Day 1 of Jury trial.  Court will hear the motions in limine at this time.  Arguments by both counsel.  State does not object to witnesses outlined in 1-3 of the defendant's witness list.  Court excludes any testimony and witnesses from number 5.  Court takes motion under advisement regarding the rest of the defendant's witness list.  Court will select 2 alternates.  Exhibits will be premarked.  Court takes recess at 9:14.  Potential jurors sent for at 9:42.  Trial resumed at 9:55.  Potential jurors arrive at 10:02.  Potential jurors sworn in on voir dire.  Court conducts voir dire.  State conducts voir dire.  Defense conducts voir dire.  Counsel exercise peremptory strikes.  14 jurors selected.  Remaining potential jurors excused at 11:01.  Jurors sworn in to try the issues.  Court reads preliminary jury instructions.  Jurors excused and Court takes recess at 11:12.  Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 11:27.  Opening statements by the State.  State calls Ellen Cook to the stand.  Ms. Cook sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and redirect.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Jurors excused and Court takes recess at 11:56.  Trial resumed at 12:55.  Jurors recalled at 12:57.  State calls Judge Ralph Ramirez to the stand.  Judge Ramirez testified on direct examination and cross examination.  Exhibit 2 marked.  Jurors excused and Court takes recess at 2:34.  Trial resumed and jurors recalled at 2:50.  Exhibits 1 and 2 offered and received by the Court.  State calls Detective Robert Brenner to the stand.  Detective Brenner sworn in and testified on direct examination and cross examination.  State rests. Jurors excused at 3:04.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court denies defense's motion.  Court takes recess at 3:10.  Trial resumed at 3:18.  Court conducts colloquy with defendant.  Defense calls the defendant to the stand.  Defendant sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and redirect.  Defense rests.  Court declares testimony and evidence closed.  Jurors excused for the evening at 4:00 and are instructed to return at 9:20 am on Tuesday.  Parties discuss jury instructions.  Court adjourns for the evening at 4:22.
Filed by the State.
Jury status hearing on March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch by phone.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Williams appeared by video.  Defendant rejects the State's offer.  Parties remain in a contested posture.  Jury instructions were due today.  Attorney Bloch may submit his tomorrow.  State filed jury instruction in court today.  State has not yet received the witness list from the Defense.  Attorney Bloch will file that in the morning as well.  Jury trial remains on the Court's calendar as previously scheduled.

Court orders Attorney Bloch to have a phone conference with his client tomorrow morning.  The conference to be concluded by 11:00 am.  Court will hold another jury status conference tomorrow.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Williams appeared by video.
Defendant withdraws Motion to Demand Legal Representation, Court accepts the withdraw of the Motion. 
The Court will not accept any more hand written Motions written by the defendant. 
Motion for Bond Hearing/Bail, Motion Indigency Hearing, and Motion Change of Venue are denied. 
Attorney Bloch would like to continue on the Motion for Speedy Trial. 
Court sets this matter for Jury Status and Jury Trial.  Court date of February 6, 2015 will be removed from the calendar. 

Parties are to exchange witness list's by February 25, 2015.
Both Parties are to file proposed Jury Instructions with the Court by March 2, 2015. Parties are to file the instructions in word document via email to the Court.  
Trial is expected to last 5 days.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 04:00 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Bradley J. Bloch.   Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Sandy Williams appeared by video. Defense acknowledges recipe of file from Attorney Witt. Court discusses the defendant's request for a speedy trial. Defense and State request a continued Court date for the trial. Defendant withdraws his request for a speedy trial. The Court accepts the request to withdraw the speedy trial and will remove the scheduled Jury Status and Jury Trial dates.

Arguments by the defense in regards to the Bail Motion filed. State requests bail remains as fixed. The Court denied the Motion to Modify Bail. Court will set this matter to discuss the rescheduling of the Jury Trial. Both parties are to come prepaired with potential trial dates. 

Court denies all motions filed pro se by the defendant with the notation that Attorney Bloch can refile any appropriate Motions. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with attorney Michael C. Witt.   Michael C. Witt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court discusses which Motions will be heard today. 
Court will hear the Motion to Withdraw as Counsel. Court conducts colloquy with the defendant in regards to his representation. Court grants the defense's request to allow Attorney Witt to withdraw. Attorney Witt to submitt an Order for the Court to sign. 

Court refers the defendant to the State Public Defenders Office, upon the determination they are to inform the Court on the defendant's eligibility. If the defendant is not eligible the Court will appoint a new attorney. The Public Defender's Office is to evaluate the defendant and notify the Court by December 8, 2014. The Court to notify Attorney Witt of the new counsel. 

The Court will hear the filed bail motion on December 12, 2014 with the defendant's new representation. 
The Court will leave the jury status and jury trial as scheduled and will discuss at the next scheduled hearing.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody.  Susan L. Opper appeared by phone for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Information admitted; reading waived. Maximum penalties recited. 
Atty. Witt informs the Court that the defendant wishes to exercise his right to substitution. That the defense does not oppose this Court conducting the Arraignment on behalf of the Court that will be assigned. Written motion for substitution filed by Atty. Witt. (Attorney Witt will mail ADA Opper a copy). Procedural and applicable substitution statute reviewed by the Court and Counsel. 
Court finds the substitution to be proper and timely. 

Court declines to go further and conduct the Arraignment; presents basis. Defense moves that the Defendant be held in Jefferson County pending trial; presents basis including access to counsel. Recess 2:55 pm
Case to be scheduled once a subsequent Court is assigned.

MINUTES UPDATED ON 03/28/18: Appearances corrected to list as - Defendant John A. Bell appears in custody with Atty. Michael Witt, DDA Opper appears for the State by phone. Also was missing - Judicial Reassignment.

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called at 10:44 am Court reviews case history, status and filings. ADA Opper acknowledges receipt of the Notice of Intent to file Learned Treatise filed by Attorney Witt. 
Detective Robert Brenner sworn and testifies:
-Direct examination by ADA Opper
-State's Exh #1- Packet of copies of letters- Offered and Received. 
-Cross examinartion by Atty. Witt
-Redirect examination by ADA Opper
Defense will not call witnesses, but requests that the Court take judical notice of the learned treatise (King James Bible excerpt.) State does not oppose. Court received the learned treatise as offered. 
Evidence closed. Arguments presented by Counsel. 
Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony; present basis. 
Court binds the Defendant over for trial. 
Information filed by the State. 
Defense requests an adjournment prior to arraignment. State does not oppose the request. 
Case will be recalled at 2:30 for Arraignment. ADA Opper to appear by phone.

MINUTES CORRECTED ON 03/28/18: Corrected as to appearances: Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody, with Atty. Michael Witt.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also Next Activity: Arraignment Date: 9/22/14 at 2:30 pm.

Copy of Court Minutes from Indigency hearing held on September 11, 2014

Defendant John A Bell in court, in custody appearing by video from the Waukesha County Courthouse.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video from the Waukesha County Courthouse.

Court reviews the procedural posture of the case. 
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 

JOHN BELL- sworn in and testifies. 
-Court examines the defendant

Court presents basic and finds the defendant indigent and appoints Attorney Michael Witt at county expense, paid at the standard rate. Court reviews that the issue of recoupment will be determined at the conclusion of the case or at some other future junction. 

Court makes a good cause finding to hold the Preliminary Hearing on September 22, 2014 based on the Court's availability and the need for the Defendant and the newly appointed Court appointed Counsel to prepare. 

Court verifies with the defendant that the Date of Birth and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived;charges and maximum penalties recited. 

Court inquires if the State will be preparing a writ to have the defendant transported to Jefferson County for the Preliminary Hearing. 
ADA Opper informs the Court that the State will prepare a writ to have the defendant transported to the Jefferson County Courthouse for the September 22, 2014 Preliminary Hearing. 

Defendant advises that he filed a motion to have his bail reduced. 
ADA Opper informs the Court that the State has not received a copy of the Defendant's Motion. ADA Opper waives time to be properly noticed of the Defendant's Motion to Reduce the bail. 

Defendant presents argument in favor of his Motion to Reduce Bail. 

Court reviews that it had previously reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that the criminal complaint states probable cause to support Count One. 

ADA Opper opposes the Defendant's Motion to Reduce Bail. 
Court presents basis and denies the Defendant's Motion to Reduce Bail.
Jail Inmate Communications form in regards to the defendant's right to counsel and bail reduction hearing.
